sentence.Network_en: In the United States lanes are reserved for cars with more than one occupant.
sentence.Network_cn: 在美国，多人乘坐的汽车有专行道。

sentence.Network_en: He shrug his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
sentence.Network_cn: 他耸耸肩表示对那房间的住户不屑一顾。

sentence.Network_en: He pushed the frightened occupant aside and rushed out through the doorway.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把吓坏了的人推到一边冲出门去.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the legal sense 'person who establishes a title'): from French, or from Latin occupant- 'seizing', from the verb occupare

entry.tran: （建筑物、房间等的）居住者，使用者
entry.def: The occupants of a building or room are the people who live or work there.

example.ex: Most of the occupants had left before the fire broke out...
example.tran: 大部分住户在火灾发生前就已经离开。

example.ex: The filing cabinets had all gone with the previous occupants.
example.tran: 那些文件柜都被之前的用户搬了个精光。

entry.tran: （某一时刻房间、交通工具、床等的）占用者
entry.def: You can refer to the people who are in a place such as a room, vehicle, or bed at a particular time as the occupants.

example.ex: He wanted the occupants of the vehicle to get out...
example.tran: 他想让车上的乘客下车。

example.ex: The lifeboat capsized, throwing the occupants into the water.
example.tran: 救生艇倾覆，艇里的人被掀入水中。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who lives at a particular place for a prolonged period or who was born there

auth_sentence.content: The occupant was a financier at a prominent private-equity firm.
auth_sentence.res_content: The occupant was a financier at a prominent private-equity firm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The occupant was a financier at a prominent private-equity firm.

auth_sentence.content: This dirty rented space, its frightened occupant.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: This dirty rented space, its frightened occupant.

auth_sentence.content: Lake Carrington is enormous and speculative but not quite occupant-ready.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lake Carrington is enormous and speculative but not quite occupant-ready.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lake Carrington is enormous and speculative but not quite occupant-ready.

stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先+occupation[n.职业;占有]→预先占有

means.word_mean: (房屋等的)居住者, 占有人

sentences.en: The previous occupants had left the house in a terrible mess.
sentences.cn: 前房客走后屋里凌乱不堪。
